entry.title: Pashinyan says he is ready to sign a peace treaty with Azerbaijan

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan says he is ready to sign a peace treaty with Azerbaijan
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe Armenian government is ready to start the process of concluding a peace treaty with Azerbaijan, says Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. üìçPrime Minister Nikol Pashinyan criticized the Russia-led Collective Security Treaty Organization for failing to respond to incursions by Azerbaijani troops into Armenia last May. üìçDeputies of the Armenian National Assembly attempted to go to Karabakh (Artsakh) on Tuesday, but were barred from entering.

entry.title: Region‚Äôs biggest science festival coming to Yerevan in September 2022

media:group.media:title: Region‚Äôs biggest science festival coming to Yerevan in September 2022
media:group.media:description:
Garik Israelian is an astrophysicist, scientist and co-founder of Starmus, a global science festival that brings together some of the brightest minds in the scientific community. In 2022, the festival will take place in Yerevan. In an interview with CivilNet, Professor Israelian discusses Armenia‚Äôs ability to invest in science, research and development, and his own work to prove that supernova explosions result in the creation of stellar black holes.
